00047 static float average(const vector<float> &data)
00048 {
00049         double sum = 0;
00050         int n = (int)data.size();
00051         for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00052                 sum += data[i];
00053         return (float) (sum / n);
00054 }
00055 
00056 static float percentile(const vector<float> &data, int percentile)
00057 {
00058         if (data.size() == 0)
00059                 return numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
00060     double dindex = percentile * ((data.size()-1) / 100.0f);
00061     int index = (int) (dindex + 0.5f);
00062         if (abs(dindex - index) <= numeric_limits<float>::epsilon())
00063         return data[index];
00064     else
00065         return (data[index-1] + data[index])/2;
00066 }
00067 
00068 static void trimSpaces(string& str)
00069 {
00070         // Trim Both leading and trailing spaces
00071         size_t startpos = str.find_first_not_of(" \t"); // Find the first character position after excluding leading blank spaces
00072         size_t endpos = str.find_last_not_of(" \t");            // Find the first character position from reverse af
00073 
00074         // if all spaces or empty return an empty string
00075         if(( string::npos == startpos ) || ( string::npos == endpos))
00076         {
00077                 str = "";
00078         }
00079         else
00080                 str = str.substr( startpos, endpos-startpos+1 );
00081 }
00082 
00083 static vector<string> split(const string& inputString, const string& delim)
00084 {
00085         vector<string> tokens;
00086         size_t substrBegin = 0;
00087         for (;;)
00088         {
00089                 size_t substrEnd = inputString.find (delim, substrBegin);
00090                 if (substrEnd == string::npos)
00091                 {
00092                         // No more delim - save what's left, quit.
00093                         string subString = inputString.substr (substrBegin);
00094                         trimSpaces(subString);
00095                         // Avoid returning a null string from a terminating '?' or an empty inputString.
00096                         if (! subString.empty())
00097                                 tokens.push_back (subString);
00098                         break;
00099                 }
00100                 // Avoid null strings from an initial 'delim' or 'delimdelim'.
00101                 if (substrEnd != substrBegin)
00102                 {
00103                         string token(inputString.substr(substrBegin, substrEnd - substrBegin));
00104                         trimSpaces(token);
00105                         tokens.push_back (token);
00106                 }
00107                 // Continue following the delim
00108                 substrBegin = substrEnd + delim.size();
00109         }
00110         return tokens;
00111 }
00112 
00113 static vector<string> split(const string &inputString)
00114 {
00115         return split(inputString, "?");
00116 }
00117 
00118 static string removeAlleleCode(const string &name)
00119 {
00120         string::size_type n = name.find_last_of("-");
00121         if (n != string::npos)
00122         {
00123                 return name.substr(0, n);
00124         }
00125         else
00126         {
00127                 return name;
00128         }
00129 }
00130 
00131 static bool hasAlleleCode(const string &name)
00132 {
00133         string::size_type n = name.find_last_of("-");
00134         return (n != string::npos);
00135 }
00136 
00137 // This maps between a particle name and the data for that particle.
00138 // Used in sorting.
00139 struct NameDataMap
00140 {
00141         string name;    // particle name
00142         int ifile;              // channel file index
00143         int j;                          // row index
00144 
00145         NameDataMap()
00146         {
00147                 ifile = j = -1;
00148         }
00149 
00150         NameDataMap(string name_, int ifile_, int j_)
00151         {
00152                 name = name_;
00153                 ifile = ifile_;
00154                 j = j_;
00155         }
00156 
00157         // comparison functor
00158         int operator() (const NameDataMap& lhs, const NameDataMap& rhs)
00159         {
00160                 return (lhs.name < rhs.name);
00161         }
00162 };

00166 ChannelTwoPointNormalizationEngine * ChannelTwoPointNormalizationEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00167 {
00168         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == ChannelTwoPointNormalizationEngine::EngineName())
00169                 return (ChannelTwoPointNormalizationEngine *)engine;
00170         return NULL;
00171 }

00183 void ChannelTwoPointNormalizationEngine::defineOptions()
00184 {
00185         defineOption("", "in-summary-files", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00186                 "Text file specifying the summary data.",
00187                 "");
00188         defineOption("", "in-count-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00189                 "Text file specifying the count data.",
00190                 "");
00191         defineOption("", "marker-content-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00192                 "Text file specifying the mix file.",
00193                 "");
00194         defineOption("", "out-summary-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00195                 "Text file specifying the summary data.",
00196                 "");
00197         defineOption("", "percentile", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00198                 "The percentile value to calculate.",
00199                 "50");
00200         defineOption("", "neg-control-target", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00201                 "The negative control target.",
00202                 "575");
00203         defineOption("", "target", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00204                 "The non-negative control target.",
00205                 "800");
00206         defineOption("", "type-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00207                 "The column name for the type.",
00208         "Type");
00209         defineOption("", "note-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00210                 "The column name for the note.",
00211         "Note");
00212         defineOption("", "probe-id-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00213                 "The column name for the probe id.",
00214         "Probe Id");
00215         defineOption("", "min-particle-count", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00216                 "The minimum particle count.",
00217                 "10");
00218         defineOption("", "compute-target", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00219                 "Compute the target by averaging medians from all channels.  target value will be ignored if compute-target is true.",
00220                 "false");
00221 }

00225 /**
00226  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00227  */
00228 void ChannelTwoPointNormalizationEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00229 {
00230         string file;
00231         file = getOpt("in-summary-files");
00232         if (file.empty() == true)
00233                 Err::errAbort("Must specify input summary files.");
00234         vector<string> files = split(file);
00235         //if (files.size() < 2)
00236         //      Err::errAbort("Must specify at least two input summary files.");
00237         file = getOpt("in-count-file");
00238         if (file.empty() == true)
00239                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input count file.");
00240         file = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00241         if (file.empty() == true)
00242                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input marker file.");
00243         file = getOpt("out-summary-file");
00244         if (file.empty() == true)
00245                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output summary file.");
00246 }

00248 void ChannelTwoPointNormalizationEngine::writeHeader(std::ofstream &out)
00249 {
00250         std::vector<std::string> option_names;
00251         getOptionNames(option_names);
00252         std::vector<PgOpt::PgOptType> option_types;
00253         getOptionTypes(option_types);
00254         for (int i = 0; i < option_names.size(); i++) 
00255         {
00256                 switch (option_types[i]) 
00257                 {
00258                 case PgOpt::BOOL_OPT:
00259                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptBool(option_names[i]) << endl;
00260                         break;
00261                 case PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT:
00262                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptDouble(option_names[i]) << endl;
00263                         break;
00264                 case PgOpt::INT_OPT:
00265                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptInt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00266                         break;
00267                 case PgOpt::STRING_OPT:
00268                         if (getOpt(option_names[i]).empty() == false)
00269                                 out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOpt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00270                 }
00271         }
00272 }

00274 /**
00275    This is the "main()" equivalent of the engine.
00276 */
00277 void ChannelTwoPointNormalizationEngine::runImp()
00278 {
00279         vector<string> inFiles = split(getOpt("in-summary-files"));
00280         string countFile = getOpt("in-count-file");
00281         string mixFile = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00282         string outFile = getOpt("out-summary-file");
00283         int perc = getOptInt("percentile");
00284         int negTarget = getOptInt("neg-control-target");
00285         bool computeTarget = getOptBool("compute-target");
00286         int target = getOptInt("target");
00287         int minCount = getOptInt("min-particle-count");
00288 
00289         // Open the mix file and store those negative type entries.
00290         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00291         if(tsv.open(mixFile) != TSV_OK)
00292                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + mixFile);
00293         tsv.rewind();
00294         map<string, bool> controlMap;
00295         int typeValue;
00296         string note;
00297         string id;
00298         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("type-col"), &typeValue, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00299         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("note-col"), &note, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00300         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("probe-id-col"), &id, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00301         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00302         {
00303                 if (typeValue < 0)
00304                 {
00305                         if (id.empty() == true)
00306                                 id = note;
00307                         controlMap[id] = true;
00308                 }
00309         }
00310         tsv.clear();
00311 
00312         // Open the count file and read the sample names.
00313         affx::TsvFile countTsv;
00314         if(countTsv.open(countFile) != TSV_OK)
00315                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + countFile);
00316         countTsv.rewind();
00317 
00318         // Get the column names from the counts file and save to the output file.
00319         ofstream out(outFile.c_str(), ios::out);
00320         writeHeader(out);
00321         string columnName;
00322         vector<string> columnNames;
00323         int n = countTsv.getColumnCount(0);
00324         for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00325         {
00326                 columnName = countTsv.getColumnName(0, i);
00327                 columnNames.push_back(columnName);
00328                 out << columnName;
00329                 if (i < n - 1)
00330                         out << "\t";
00331         }
00332         out << endl;
00333 
00334         // Allocate a vector of data for the row and bind to the columns.
00335         string name;
00336         vector<string> rowNames;
00337         vector<int> count(n-1);
00338         countTsv.bind(0, 0, &name, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00339         for (int i=1; i<n; i++)
00340         {
00341                 countTsv.bind(0, i, &count[i-1],  TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00342         }
00343 
00344         vector<bool> isControlRow;
00345         vector<vector<int> > countData(n-1);  
00346         vector<vector<int> > nonControlCountData(n-1); 
00347         while(countTsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00348         {
00349                 rowNames.push_back(name);
00350                 bool isControl = (controlMap.find(name) != controlMap.end());
00351                 isControlRow.push_back(isControl);
00352                 for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00353                 {
00354                         countData[i].push_back(count[i]);
00355                         if (isControl == false)
00356                         {
00357                                 nonControlCountData[i].push_back(count[i]);
00358                         }
00359                 }
00360         }
00361         countTsv.clear();
00362 
00363         vector<double> data(n-1);
00364         vector<vector<double> > minData(inFiles.size());
00365         vector<vector<string> > names(inFiles.size());
00366         vector<NameDataMap> nameDataMap;
00367         vector<vector<vector<float> > > sampleData(inFiles.size()); 
00368 
00369         // Loop through the data files and read the data.
00370         for (int ifile = 0; ifile < inFiles.size(); ++ifile)
00371         {
00372                 if(tsv.open(inFiles[ifile]) != TSV_OK)
00373                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + inFiles[ifile]);
00374                 tsv.rewind();
00375 
00376                 // Check the column names
00377                 int cols = tsv.getColumnCount(0);
00378                 for (int i=0; i<cols; i++)
00379                 {
00380                         string columnName = tsv.getColumnName(0, i);
00381                         if (columnName != columnNames[i])
00382                         {
00383                                 // Column names in the counts file do not match those in this signals file.
00384                                 Err::errAbort("The counts and signals files do not appear to be consistent. Column names don't match. (Counts file column:'"
00385                                         + columnNames[i] + "', " + inFiles[ifile] + " file column: '" + columnName +"')");
00386                         }
00387                 }
00388 
00389                 tsv.bind(0, 0, &name, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00390                 for (int i=1; i<n; i++)
00391                 {
00392                         tsv.bind(0, i, &data[i-1],  TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00393                 }
00394 
00395                 minData[ifile].resize(n-1, std::numeric_limits<double>::max());
00396 
00397                 // Get the data. Separate the control from non-control values.
00398                 // Only retrieve the counts for the controls.
00399                 int irow = 0;
00400                 while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00401                 {
00402                         // Check the row names.
00403                         bool countNameHasCode = hasAlleleCode(rowNames[irow]);
00404                         string nameNoAlleleCode = countNameHasCode ? name : removeAlleleCode(name);
00405                         if (rowNames[irow] != nameNoAlleleCode)
00406                         {
00407                                 // Row names in the counts file do not match those in this signals file.
00408                                 Err::errAbort("The counts and signals files do not appear to be consistent. Row names don't match. (Counts file row:'"
00409                                         + rowNames[irow] + "', " + inFiles[ifile] + " file row (with Allele code): '" + name +"')");
00410                         }
00411 
00412                         sampleData[ifile].resize(n-1);
00413 
00414                         bool isControl = (controlMap.find(name) != controlMap.end());
00415                         if (isControl == false)
00416                         {
00417                                 names[ifile].push_back(name);
00418                                 NameDataMap ndm(name, ifile, sampleData[ifile].size() > 0 ? sampleData[ifile][0].size() : 0);
00419                                 nameDataMap.push_back(ndm);
00420                         }
00421 
00422                         for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00423                         {
00424                                 if (countData[i].size() >= minCount)
00425                                         minData[ifile][i] = min(minData[ifile][i], data[i]);
00426 
00427                                 if (isControl == false)
00428                                 {
00429                                         sampleData[ifile][i].push_back(data[i]);
00430                                 }
00431                         }
00432 
00433                         ++irow;
00434                 }
00435                 tsv.clear();
00436         }
00437 
00438         data.erase(data.begin(), data.end());
00439         count.erase(count.begin(), count.end());
00440 
00441         // Compute the weighted average of the controls and the
00442         // percentile of the non-controls.
00443         vector<bool> skipNorm(n-1);
00444         vector<float> percentiles(inFiles.size());
00445         vector<vector<float> > slope(n-1);
00446         vector<vector<float> > intercept(n-1);
00447         for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00448         {
00449                 slope[i].resize(inFiles.size());
00450                 intercept[i].resize(inFiles.size());
00451 
00452                 for (int ifile = 0; ifile < inFiles.size(); ++ifile)
00453                 {
00454                         vector<float> temp;
00455                         for (int j=0; j<(int)nonControlCountData[i].size(); j++)
00456                         {
00457                                 if (nonControlCountData[i][j] >= minCount)
00458                                         temp.push_back(sampleData[ifile][i][j]);
00459                         }
00460 
00461                         skipNorm[i] = (temp.size() < 2);        // set to the same value in each pass through the for loop. redundant but ok.
00462 
00463                         if (skipNorm[i] == false)
00464                         {
00465                                 std::sort(temp.begin(), temp.end());
00466                                 percentiles[ifile] = percentile(temp, perc);
00467                         }
00468                         else
00469                         {
00470                                 percentiles[ifile] = 1.0f;      // just pass through the computation without blowing-up.  The value will not be used.
00471                         }
00472                 }
00473 
00474                 float avgRange = target; //average(percentiles);
00475                 float avgControl = negTarget; //average(wavg);
00476 
00477                 if (computeTarget)
00478                 {
00479                         avgRange = 0;
00480                         for (int ifile = 0; ifile < inFiles.size(); ++ifile)
00481                         {
00482                                 avgRange += (percentiles[ifile] - minData[ifile][i]);
00483                         }
00484                         avgRange /= inFiles.size();
00485                 }
00486 
00487                 // Compute the slope and intercept for each sample.
00488                 for (int ifile = 0; ifile < inFiles.size(); ++ifile)
00489                 {
00490                         slope[i][ifile] = (avgRange - avgControl) / (percentiles[ifile] - minData[ifile][i]);
00491                         intercept[i][ifile] = avgControl - (slope[i][ifile] * minData[ifile][i]);
00492                 }
00493         }
00494 
00495         // Sort the names
00496         sort(nameDataMap.begin(), nameDataMap.end(), NameDataMap());
00497 
00498         // Output the normalized signals
00499         // If there is not data then output a zero.
00500         for (int iname = 0; iname < nameDataMap.size(); ++iname)
00501         {
00502                 int ifile = nameDataMap[iname].ifile;
00503                 int j = nameDataMap[iname].j;
00504 
00505                 out << nameDataMap[iname].name;
00506                 for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00507                 {
00508                         out << "\t";
00509                         if (sampleData[ifile][i].empty() == false)
00510                         {
00511                                 if (nonControlCountData[i][j] > 0)
00512                                 {
00513                                         if (skipNorm[i] == false)
00514                                         {
00515                                                 out << (sampleData[ifile][i][j] * slope[i][ifile]) + intercept[i][ifile];
00516                                         }
00517                                         else
00518                                         {
00519                                                 // no normalization
00520                                                 out << sampleData[ifile][i][j];
00521                                         }
00522                                 }
00523                                 else
00524                                         out << -1; //-std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
00525                         }
00526                         else
00527                                 out << -1; //-std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
00528                 }
00529                 out << endl;
00530         }
00531 
00532         // Close the files
00533         out.close();
00534 }
